intro: Eugeissona major, commonly known as the giant false heather, is a species of flowering plant in the family Ericaceae. It is native to the southeastern United States, particularly in Florida and Georgia. The plant is characterized by its dense clusters of small, white to pinkish flowers that bloom in the spring. It thrives in acidic, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal dunes and sandy habitats. Eugeissona major is a low-growing shrub that plays an important role in stabilizing sand dunes and providing habitat for various wildlife species.
